leads.lead_text: Leaves apparently without a costa; lamina cells at least 25 µm long, usually much longer
Leaves with a well-defined costa; lamina cells mostly less than 25 µm long
Dorsal and apical laminae margins continuosly bordered along most of their lengths by elongated thick-walled cells
Dorsal and apical laminae margins without differentiated cells or marginal cells not far more elongated than cells near costa
Vaginant laminae fused near the costa and gaping; border of elongate cells on vaginant laminae becoming intramarginal toward base
Vaginant laminae fused well away from costa and closed; border of elongate cells on vaginant laminae marginal throughout
Stems to 6 cm long; plants aquatic or in wet places
Stems to 1 cm long; plants in moist to drier sites, generally not aquatic
Border mostly unistratose; cells of the apical and dorsal laminae mostly greater than 10 µm wide
Border four or more cells thick; cells of the apical and dorsal laminae mostly less than 10 µm wide
Border fusing with costa at apex; cells of the apical and dorsal laminae mostly 8–12 µm long
Border usually failing below apex, rarely fusing with costa; cells of the apical and dorsal laminae mostly 6–7.5 µm long
Leaves 5–9 mm long, 8–10 times as long as wide; lax aquatic plants
Leaves to 4 mm long, less than 8 times as long as wide; plants not aquatic or if aquatic, then stiff and erect
Leaves entire to denticulate at apex; margins of all laminae without a pale border of non-elongate cells
Leaves coarsely serrate at apex; margins of all laminae with a pale border of thicker and flatter, but not more elongate cells
Vaginant lamella with conspicuously serrate margins
Vaginant lamella with entire to serrulate margins
Plants always aquatic; lamina bistratose
Plants terrestrial and usually above water or if aquatic, lamina unistratose
Lamina dark green to black; plants aquatic; vaginant lamina usually with an intramarginal band of linear cells, at least toward base
Lamina yellow-green or pale-green to dark-green; plants mostly terrestrial, rarely submerged; vaginant lamina never with an intramarginal band of linear cells
Mid-stem leaves less than 1.5 mm long
Mid-stem leaves longer than 1.5 mm long
Leaves well separated on at least parts of the stem; leaf apices often recurved
Leaves close and often overlapping throughout; leaf apices always straight
Laminal cells multipappillose
Laminal cells smooth
Caspules inclined to horizontal, asymmetric and arcuate; peristome teeth spreading when dry and divided
Capsules inclined to erect, symmetric; peristome teeth spreading or erect when dry, divided or entire
Vaginant lamina rounded at apex, joining at or near the costa; base of vaginant lamina with elongate cells extending from margin for several rows of cells inward

Vaginant lamina acute or obtuse at apex, joining midway between margin and costa to closer to the margin; base of vaginant lamina entirely with non-elongate cells or elongate cells confined to marginal two cell rows
Leaves with apices inrolled toward substrate when dry; margins of apical and dorsal laminae serrulate to crenulate throughout
Leaves little altered when dry or with apices curved upwards away from substrate when dry; margins of apical and dorsal laminae entire throughout or serrulate near apex
